alert.note: Alert for Inland Indian River; Okeechobee; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Okeechobee, western Indian River and southeastern Osceola Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 519 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Kissimmee Prarie Preserve, or 10 miles west of Blue Cypress Lake, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blue Cypress Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
